channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Wharton’s Jeremy Siegel calls Trump’s tariffs the ‘biggest policy mistake in 95 years’
item.description: “I don’t know why Trump didn’t learn the lesson of the Smoot-Hawley tariff,” he said.

item.title: Mississippi Is on the Move with Conservative Reforms
item.description: Sweeping education gains, record economic development, and now, elimination of its income tax place Mississippi in a unique position. It’s winning.

item.title: Trump’s China tariffs face legal challenge from conservative group calling them ‘unlawful'
item.description: New Civil Liberties Alliance sued the Trump administration in Florida federal court Thursday over the president's executive orders imposing tariffs on...

item.title: NY Democrats Seek To Punish Musk Over His Politics
item.description: A Democrat member of the state legislature has introduced a bill avowedly aimed at punishing Elon Musk for his political activities.

item.title: Robust March jobs report signals the economy is starting from a ‘position of strength’ if Trump tariffs spark downturn
item.description: In March, the U.S. added 228,000 jobs, while the unemployment rate ticked up to 4.2%.

item.title: The stock market is crashing: Here’s what financial experts say you should do now
item.description: 'Resist the urge to shift out of stocks entirely.'

item.title: The End of the Elon Experiment
item.description: There are two Elon Musks. The public controversialist is about to give way to the man on a mission to Mars.

item.title: Trump shakes up NSA leadership, appoints new acting director and deputy to replace Biden appointees

item.title: Planned Parenthood’s Medicaid Lawfare Puts Profits over Patients
item.description: No one — not states, taxpayers, or Medicaid patients — benefits from forced funding of Planned Parenthood, and the Supreme Court should affirm that.

item.title: Trump’s Nonemergency Tariffs
item.description: This is an abuse of language and logic in the service of bad policy that hardly interacts with the alleged threat to national security.

item.title: Trump planned to import eggs to lower prices for consumers. Then came ‘Liberation Day’ tariffs
item.description: That omelet won't be getting much cheaper.

item.title: How God Won Me Over After My Dad Abandoned Me
item.description: My life changed when I learned I wasn’t alone and never will be.

item.title: The Magic of Markets
item.description: We will continue making the case for capitalism each and every day.

item.title: The pushback begins: China imposes 34% tariff on U.S. goods
item.description: China is slapping a 34% tariff on goods it imports from the U.S. in direct retaliation for President Trump's sweeping trade crackdown.

item.title: Trump’s tariffs are not ‘common sense’—and they’re putting America’s credibility and ‘exorbitant privilege’ at risk
item.description: The tariffs, which are taxes on international transactions, are destroying trillions in U.S. wealth, with the worst still to come.

item.title: Anna Paulina Luna’s ‘Pro Family’ Proxy Push Rings Hollow After She Avoided Florida’s 2024 Abortion Battle
item.description: When it came to standing against the anti-family abortion amendment in her own state last year, Luna was largely absent from the fight.

item.title: If You’re Hysterical About Trump’s Tariffs, Go Touch Grass
item.description: If toting a fainting couch around with you is your thing, fine. But there’s really no need to live this way.

item.title: Democrat Rep Jared Golden says his party's moving in 'wrong direction' on trade
item.description: Rep. Jared Golden, D-Maine, is warning his own party not to have "knee-jerk" reactions to President Donald Trump's tariff plan.

item.title: Michigan Secretary Of State Discovers 15 Possible Noncitizen Voters, Insists It’s No Big Deal
item.description: Michigan Secretary of State Jocelyn Benson claims noncitizen voting is "very rare," despite permissive practices enabling it in the past.
